column1: #Text=Polycrystalline GaV4S8−ySey materials with y between 0 and 8 were synthesized\rby thoroughly grinding stoichiometric amounts of V (99.5%, metals basis, Sigma-Aldrich), S (99.99%, Acros\rOrganics), and Se (99.999%, Alfa Aesar) powders inside an argon-filled glove box.

#Text=The mixtures of powders were\rtransferred into silica tubes along with stoichiometric amounts of Ga (99.999%, metals basis, Alfa Aesar) granules\rand 50 mg of I2 (99.99%, Alfa Aesar; added to prevent the formation of V5S8).
#Text=The mixtures were heated at a rate of 10 °C/h to 600 °C and at a rate of 5 °C/h to 820 °C, kept at this temperature\rfor 200 h, followed by water quench cooling.
#Text=This yielded black polycrystalline air-stable powders with\rmetallic lustre.
#Text=Single crystals of GaV4S8−ySey were grown using the chemical vapour phase transport (CVT) technique.
#Text=Polycrystalline materials (1.5 g), described above, and 3.3 mg/cc of the transporting agent I2 or PtCl2, were sealed in evacuated silica tubes.
#Text=The growth of single crystals was achieved by heating the source part of the tube to\r900 °C and the sink part to 850 °C for four weeks.
#Text=Black octahedral single crystals with well-defined facets of various\rsizes ranging from several microns up to 2 × 2 × 2 mm3 (Supplementary Fig.
